intro: Steenisia pterosepala, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is known for its small, white or pale yellow flowers. Steenisia pterosepala is notable for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of African flora and ethnobotany.
